definition: to pour oil on the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to pour liquid/to irrigate (using waterwheel)/to water/to cast (molten metal)/to mold
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning

sentences.english: European commissioner Chris Patten caught the mood when he suggested yesterday that Israel had dealt with a fire by pouring gasoline on the flames.
sentences.chinese: 歐盟外委會專員彭定康稱，以色列這是往火上澆油。

sentences.english: You don’t have to rub it in. I already feel bad enough as it is.
sentences.chinese: 你不要火上澆油了，我已經夠難過的。

sentences.english: China urges not to 'pour oil on flames'.
sentences.chinese: 中國警告美日韓三方不要火上澆油。

sentences.english: American officials fear the exchange of fire on Tuesday will provide yet another irritant for both sides.
sentences.chinese: 美政府官員擔心週二的交火是在爲雙方關係火上澆油。

sentences.english: My previous girlfriend was younger than me, as well, so that just adds fuel to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我以前的女友都是比我小，這無異於火上澆油。

definition: extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
to feel embarrassed/to feel akward
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
ill-gotten wealth or gains
hot flush
red in the face/extremely angry
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
argumentative/quarrelsome
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
